item.description:
The International Mountain Climbing School (IMCS) is holding their annual Mount Washington Valley Ice Festival on Fri-Sun, Feb 3-5.  Come celebrate the season, expand your winter climbing/mountaineering skills, demo new gear, meet more great people, and have fun!

During the days, they are offering special rates on an array of hands-on courses taught by either their certified guides or pro climbers. The courses range from beginner to advanced level on ice climbing, mixed climbing, and mountaineering topics.  Or you can also sign up for a guided expedition.  Or if you're already skilled, take some demo gear out for a test-drive.  Most daily activities end by 3:30 pm and there is an after-party (until 5 pm) at IME to socialize and enjoy treats and drinks with the climbing community.

On Friday night there will be a multi-media show by Will Gadd (one of the world's best; love that guy!), and a pro dry-tooling competition.  On Saturday night, there will be an open dry-tooling session, and film festival.

As a group:

For those who RSVP and/or contact me, we'll then make plans for carpooling (if interested), meeting up for dinner(s), and/or at the evening festivities.  A great chance to socialize and make more cool friends!

On your own:

You can come up for whichever days/activities you want. Contact IMCS directly to book a course or excursion with them.  Full details on their website:

http://ime-usa.com/imcs/ice_fest.html

For lodging, you'll need to make your own arrangements. IMCS lists several recommendations on their website: http://ime-usa.com/imcs/lodging.html

FYI, I'll be staying at the White Mountains Hostel (listed as "Hostelling International"):
http://www.whitemountainshostel.com/

Hope to see you there!
Deb
